channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Judge rules patient paralysed by virus should be allowed to die
item.description: A court agrees that 'distressing' life-support treatment for the woman, in her 50s, should end.

item.title: Ayia Napa: Woman appeals against conviction for false rape claim
item.description: The woman challenges her conviction for making a false report of an attack by 12 men in a hotel room.

item.title: Blackpool Illuminations 2021: Switch-on honour for Strictly's Ballas
item.description: Shirley Ballas leads a star-studded line-up to start an extended run for Blackpool's famous lights.

item.title: Neo-Nazi Matthew Cronjager guilty of plotting terrorist acts
item.description: Matthew Cronjager, 18, wanted to shoot an Asian friend who had boasted he slept with "white chicks".

item.title: Hisham Chaudhary: Oadby terrorist who funded IS with Bitcoin jailed
item.description: Hisham Chaudhary used Bitcoin to free IS supporters from detention camps, police say.

item.title: Aston Martin Bulldog unveiled after Bridgnorth restoration
item.description: The only Bulldog ever made is being shown off after 40 years in the automotive wilderness.

item.title: Benefits cheat jailed for Â£33,000 false disability claims
item.description: A judge brands Ann Hooper's false claim that she was "too disabled to move" as a "ridiculous lie".

item.title: Partially-shredded Banksy back under the hammer at Sotheby's
item.description: The artwork, re-titled Love Is In The Bin, will appear at a Sotheby's auction in October.

item.title: Stem cell transplant for Bridgnorth boy with rare condition
item.description: Gunner's mum says she faces a tough wait to find out how successful the operation has been.

item.title: Dizzee Rascal: Rapper denies headbutting ex-girlfriend
item.description: The rapper, whose real name is Dylan Mills, is due to go on trial in February next year.

item.title: Man, 86, died in Bude Canal saving disabled daughter
item.description: Lawrence Casey's family say "his final act of love" was to "sacrifice his life to save hers".

item.title: Four Met Police officers injured in anti-vaccine protest
item.description: The Met Police brands the violent behaviour of anti-vaccine protesters "unacceptable".

item.title: Birmingham dancing thief's 'fancy footwork' caught on camera
item.description: Police describe Abdelhadi Bahou Jabour's moves as "part Bruce Forsyth, part Artful Dodger".

item.title: Derby wife killer's supervision 'not robust enough'
item.description: Sobhia Khan was murdered by her husband two days after he met with a mental health care coordinator.

item.title: Ironbridge power station chimney demolished
item.description: The last major structure at the Ironbridge Power Station is brought down in a controlled explosion.

item.title: Wirral Mind fundraiser completes year of daily 10km runs
item.description: Phill Hayward kept his challenge interesting by going runs while dribbling a ball and running in heels.

item.title: Decades-old Broadstairs ice cream parlour makes it through 'difficult period'
item.description: Six generations of Morellis have worked at the family's ice cream parlour in Broadstairs, Kent.

item.title: Paralympics: Husband praises 'incredible' Dame Sarah Storey
item.description: Dame Sarah Storey is Great Britain's most successful Paralympian after winning her 17th gold medal.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo superfan relishes Manchester United return
item.description: Dominic Urbani is so obsessed with Cristiano Ronaldo that he studied for a degree in Portuguese.

item.title: Leeds Festival: Victim attacked with acid during Post Malone set
item.description: Olly Spencer-Littlewood says he feared he would be scarred for life after the attack.

item.title: Reading stabbings: Bravery awards for police who tackled terrorist
item.description: The officers are honoured for apprehending a man who murdered three people in Reading in June 2020.

item.title: Manchester Arena bomb: Three PCs on duty face internal investigations
item.description: Three officers are to face internal investigations over their actions on the night of the atrocity.

item.title: England v India: Ollie Pope and Chris Woakes star on hard-fought day
item.description: Ollie Pope strikes 81 and Chris Woakes 50 but England's fourth Test against India remains tantalisingly poised after a see-saw second day at The Kia Oval.

item.title: Man Utd open WSL season with victory over Reading
item.description: Manchester United open the new Women's Super League season with victory over Reading in manager Marc Skinner's first game in charge.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton breaks down in Dutch Grand Prix practice as Charles Leclerc fastest
item.description: Charles Leclerc leads a Ferrari one-two in Dutch Grand Prix second practice while Lewis Hamilton misses most of the session.

item.title: Hungary v England: Fifa opens disciplinary proceedings after racist abuse aimed at players
item.description: Fifa opens disciplinary proceedings after racist abuse was aimed at England players during Thursday's 4-0 World Cup qualifier win over Hungary in Budapest.

item.title: Super League: Magic Weekend returns with end-of-season run-in hotting up
item.description: Super League's Magic Weekend returns this week for the first time since 2019 as the 2021 season draws to its conclusion.
